665823.summary: The recipe Melt Your Heart can be made in approximately 45 minutes. One portion of this dish contains approximately 4g of protein, 4g of fat, and a total of 102 calories. This recipe serves 2 and costs $1.27 per serving. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, lacto ovo vegetarian, and primal diet. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. It is brought to you by Foodista. steps.step: Give the yogurt a good stir and spoon it into the mini heart shape ice-cube tray.
Freeze it for at least 2 hours or more till harden. (you can prepared this 1 day ahead).
Rinse and cut the strawberries into halves, serve with blueberries or any fruits of your choice together with a few yogurt cubes in short glass.

1098299.summary: The recipe Berry Frozen Yogurt Popsicles can be made in about 4 hours and 20 minutes. This recipe makes 10 servings with 64 calories, 1g of protein, and 2g of fat each. For 63 cents per serving, this recipe covers 3% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 2 people were impressed by this recipe. Head to the store and pick up frozen vanilla yogurt, raspberries, blueberries, and a few other things to make it today. It is brought to you by Foodista. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian, and fodmap friendly diet. Overall, this recipe earns a rather bad spoonacular score of 27%. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as Berry Frozen Yogurt Popsicles, Raspberry-Maple Frozen Yogurt Popsicles, and Berry Yogurt Popsicles.

steps.step: Add the vanilla frozen yogurt, 3 oz raspberries, and 3 oz blueberries to a food processor or blender. Pulse about 20 times until the fruit is broken up and the mixture is smooth.Scoop 1 TBSP of the fro-yo mixture into each of your popsicle molds. Drop a couple of blueberries in each mold.

Add another tablespoon of the fro-yo mixture to each mold. Now add a couple of raspberries. Then add another tablespoon of the fro-yo mixture to each mold and repeat with the blueberries and then again with the raspberries (if you have room).Freeze the pops until solid, at least 4 hours. To release the popsicles just run the molds under really warm water for 10-15 seconds. Jiggle and pull out!Enjoy!

information.instructions:
1. Add the vanilla frozen yogurt, 3 oz raspberries, and 3 oz blueberries to a food processor or blender. Pulse about 20 times until the fruit is broken up and the mixture is smooth.
  2. Scoop 1 TBSP of the fro-yo mixture into each of your popsicle molds. Drop a couple of blueberries in each mold.
  3. Add another tablespoon of the fro-yo mixture to each mold. Now add a couple of raspberries.
  4. Then add another tablespoon of the fro-yo mixture to each mold and repeat with the blueberries and then again with the raspberries (if you have room).
  5. Freeze the pops until solid, at least 4 hours.
  6. To release the popsicles just run the molds under really warm water for 10-15 seconds. Jiggle and pull out!
  7. Enjoy!

steps.step: Add the vanilla frozen yogurt, 3 oz raspberries, and 3 oz blueberries to a food processor or blender. Pulse about 20 times until the fruit is broken up and the mixture is smooth.Scoop 1 TBSP of the fro-yo mixture into each of your popsicle molds. Drop a couple of blueberries in each mold.

Add another tablespoon of the fro-yo mixture to each mold. Now add a couple of raspberries. Then add another tablespoon of the fro-yo mixture to each mold and repeat with the blueberries and then again with the raspberries (if you have room).Freeze the pops until solid, at least 4 hours. To release the popsicles just run the molds under really warm water for 10-15 seconds. Jiggle and pull out!Enjoy!

productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.
productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are great choices for Frozen Yogurt. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

winePairing.pairingText: Fruit Salad can be paired with Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Foley Estate Winery Sta. Rita Hills Chardonnay with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 27 dollars per bottle.

639167.summary: Need a gluten free, dairy free, paleolithic, and lacto ovo vegetarian hor d'oeuvre? Chocolate Plums could be an excellent recipe to try. This recipe serves 24 and costs 38 cents per serving. One serving contains 86 calories, 1g of protein, and 5g of fat. It is brought to you by Foodista. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. If you have dried plums, almonds, dark chocolate, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 21%, which is not so amazing. If you like this recipe, take a look at these similar recipes: Chocolate Cardamom Plums Clafoutis, Roasted Plums, and Sugar plums.

steps.step: Prepare a baking sheet by lining it with parchment paper and set aside for now.

Chop the chocolate into small pieces and place it in a sauce pan. Cook on low, stirring continuously, until the chocolate is melted. Stir until the chocolate is smooth, and allow it to sit and cool slightly while you prepare the prunes.

Insert the almonds into the centers of the prunes, one nut per prune. I find its easier to use the tapered end of the nut to poke into the center of the prune. If you have difficulty, can use a paring knife to create a small hole for inserting the nut.
Use a fork or dipping tools to dip one of the prunes into the chocolate, submerging it completely.
Remove it from the chocolate and drag the bottom along the lip of the bowl to remove the excess chocolate.
Place it on the prepared baking sheet and, if desired, sprinkle the top with crushed nuts while the chocolate is still wet.

Repeat the dipping with the remaining prunes and chocolate. Once all of the prunes are on the baking sheet, let the chocolate set like this (dont put them in the fridge because Chocolate Plums will look mat). Store Chocolate Plums in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.
